abstract: In the last few years, Americans have become less inclined to support government policies that try to reduce income inequality.
snippet: In the last few years, Americans have become less inclined to support government policies that try to reduce income inequality.
lead_paragraph: As Rich Oppel and I wrote in an article today, the Republican presidential candidates have been steadily promoting flatter - and therefore more regressive - tax overhaul plans. Flatter taxes have of course always been the holy grail for many in the conservative base, but now such proposals seem to be gathering broader support, too.
